tweet: As Hurricane Dorian’s path becomes clearer in the days and hours ahead, @sendavidperdue and I urge Georgians to take precautions early and follow the advice of state and local officials.  https://www.isakson.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/8/isakson-perdue-urge-georgians-to-prepare-heed-officials-warnings-ahead-of-hurricane-dorian … pic.twitter.com/Rv89Lz9Ns8

My family, my staff and I have been so touched by the outpouring of love and support we've received in response to my decision to step down at the end of this year. I’m looking forward to the work we can accomplish in the months ahead. Thank you!

After much prayer and consultation with my family and doctors, I have made the very tough decision to leave the U.S. Senate at the end of 2019. It has been the honor of a lifetime serving the state of Georgia. This decision pains me greatly but I know it is the right thing to do.

In July, we celebrated the 50th anniversary of the moon landing. Now, we celebrate the completion of @NASA_SLS rocket’s engine section, bringing us another leap closer to our goal of returning humans to the Moon. More on @NASA’s #Artemis 1 project: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=dOKKkV-30dE …

My chief of staff attended U.S. District Court Judge for the Northern District of Georgia J.P. Boulee's formal investiture ceremony today in Atlanta. Congratulations @judgejpboulee, and thank you for your service! 
Background:  https://www.isakson.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/isakson-perdue-applaud-confirmation-of-boulee-to-u-s-district-court … pic.twitter.com/jXDzjybLTG

My staff joined @AmericanLegion Post 201 today at a ceremony to present a Georgia state senate-passed resolution urging Congressional passage of a measure I introduced to award WWII heroes Merrill’s Marauders, modern-day @USArmy Rangers, with the Congressional Gold Medal. pic.twitter.com/1ZjaPBMONe

Today’s action by @POTUS mirrors legislation I introduced to make federal student debt forgiveness automatic for totally & permanently disabled veterans. I look forward to furthering our shared goal of taking care of our veterans who sacrificed so much.  https://www.isakson.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/7/isakson-offers-bipartisan-plan-to-waive-student-debt-for-disabled-veterans … https://twitter.com/WhiteHouse/status/1164277841728626689 …

Today, @POTUS attended the 75th annual @AMVETSHQ national convention in Louisville, Ky., where he thanked our nation’s heroes for their brave service on behalf of all Americans. Green Beret Dustin Wright was posthumously honored at a moving ceremony this week in Toombs County, Ga. @USArmy commanders presented Staff Sgt. Wright's family with the Silver Star he earned for his heroic actions in Niger in 2017. Watch:  https://www.wtoc.com/2019/08/15/parents-fallen-green-berets-parents-presented-with-silver-star/ … via @WTOC11

On #NationalAirborneDay, we recognize August 16, 1940 – the date of the first official @USArmy parachute jump at @FortBenning, Ga. President George W. Bush proclaimed National Airborne Day on August 14, 2002. We thank our brave paratroopers for their service! pic.twitter.com/GQ2kcAaMfN

Take my word for it, bone fractures are no fun. Wishing a speedy recovery to my friend Mitch as he heals. No one works harder in the Senate, and I’m positive this won’t set him back one bit. Looking forward to being back together in September to continue our work!
My prayers are with the families and victims of another tragic and senseless shooting in Ohio. My heart breaks.
Our prayers are with the victims, families and the entire community who have been affected by the horrific act of violence in El Paso, Texas.
